messages.subject: Re:is this worth linking to the anti-spanking page?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/2003 7:05:33 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... It s not an unschooling page...or even, I think, necessarily about anti-spanking....it s a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/2003 7:05:33 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Is this worth linking to the anti-spanking page?
>
> http://www.parentsanonymous.org/pahtml/toolBox.html
>
> I don't like the time out recommendation.
>
>

It's not an unschooling page...or even, I think, necessarily about
anti-spanking....it's a page for parents who either have been or believe they
are in danger of being child abusers. Mostly they are targeting parents who
aren't even up to Parenting 101... it's pretty remedial. From that
perspective, it's probably useful.

I think you could include it with an explanation of that. Time Out sucks, but
it VASTLY beats the risk of battering.

The question is, are you likely to get people who are at risk of battering
their children looking for links. Probably not if they're coming from an
Unschooling page....but you never know.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
